pull.title: ci: Use remote pull/merge ref instead of local git merge
pull.body:
The merge strategy on the remote may be different than the local one. This may cause local merges to be different or fail completely. Fix this by using the result of the remote merge.

Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/26163

ci: Use remote pull/merge ref instead of local git merge

The merge strategy on the remote may be different than the local one.
This may cause local merges to be different or fail completely. Fix this
by using the result of the remote merge.

events.message:
ci: Use remote pull/merge ref instead of local git merge

The merge strategy on the remote may be different than the local one.
This may cause local merges to be different or fail completely. Fix this
by using the result of the remote merge.

events.body:
ACK fad7281d7842f337932cf44e703fdd631230ddd6, I regularly use the same commands locally.

Interesting, that `git fetch origin pull/ID/merge` command was mentioned in GitHub's docs in the past. But I failed to find a reference to it now...

ACK

Checked that CI is getting the right thing checked out.

issue.title: ci: Use same `merge_script` implementation for Windows as for all
issue.body: This PR is a continuation of bitcoin/bitcoin#26202 and it suggests the same approach for the "Win64 native" CI task.

issue.title: [24.x] CI backports
issue.body:
This PR backports:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26202
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26236

to avoid CI failures like that:
- https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5653459278495744
- https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6075671743561728

issue.title: [24.x] CI backports
issue.body:
This PR backports:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26202
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26236

to avoid CI failures like that:
- https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5653459278495744
- https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6075671743561728

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,8 +30,8 @@ base_template: &BASE_TEMPLATE
     - git config --global user.email "ci@ci.ci"
     - git config --global user.name "ci"
     - if [ "$CIRRUS_PR" = "" ]; then exit 0; fi
-    - git fetch $CIRRUS_REPO_CLONE_URL $CIRRUS_BASE_BRANCH
-    - git merge FETCH_HEAD  # Merge base to detect silent merge conflicts
+    - git fetch $CIRRUS_REPO_CLONE_URL "pull/${CIRRUS_PR}/merge"
+    - git checkout FETCH_HEAD  # Use merged changes to detect silent merge conflicts
comments.body: Is comment correct? Can `git checkout` really "_detect_ silent merge conflicts"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,8 +30,8 @@ base_template: &BASE_TEMPLATE
     - git config --global user.email "ci@ci.ci"
     - git config --global user.name "ci"
     - if [ "$CIRRUS_PR" = "" ]; then exit 0; fi
-    - git fetch $CIRRUS_REPO_CLONE_URL $CIRRUS_BASE_BRANCH
-    - git merge FETCH_HEAD  # Merge base to detect silent merge conflicts
+    - git fetch $CIRRUS_REPO_CLONE_URL "pull/${CIRRUS_PR}/merge"
+    - git checkout FETCH_HEAD  # Use merged changes to detect silent merge conflicts
comments.body: Yes, the silent conflicts may be detected by the following ci script (`make check` etc). This change isn't changing that
